alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 7:35PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Harlan. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evarts, Kildav, Verda, Bailey Creek, Darkmont, Ages, Putney, Short Town, Kenvir, Coxton, Colts, Black Mountain, Rosspoint and Dizney.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
